item.title: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete - How to Get Lucky Frog
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Lily in Pocket Camp Complete

  • How to Craft Lucky Frog in Pocket Camp Complete
    • How to Complete Lily's Special Request
  • Where to Use Lucky Frog

Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete has a category of tasks called Special Requests, which allow you to craft exclusive furniture. Unlike regular requests, Special Requests are unlocked when an animal's friendship level reaches 10 or 15. Special Request furniture usually takes 9 hours or more in real time and cost 9k+ Bells to make. While Special Request furniture can be used to spruce up your campsite/cabin, you might need them for the later courses in Happy Homeroom (HH). The Lucky Frog is used in several of Pocket Camp Complete 's HH classes, but in order to craft it, you'll need to befriend Lily.

How to Get Lily in Pocket Camp Complete

What Level to Unlock Lily

To get the Lucky Frog in Pocket Camp Complete , you'll need to raise Lily 's friendship to level 15. Lily is one of the earlier animals that you can meet, and she can be unlocked from Level 6-19 . For every level in this range, you'll unlock two animals . You may get lucky and unlock Lily at level 6, or you may have to level up to 19.

Once Lily's been unlocked, she may appear at one of the locations for 3 hours, or you can go into Contacts and use a Calling Card . Animals summoned via Calling Card will stay at their respective locations for 3 hours.

Lily's theme is Cute , so giving her Cute-themed treats can boost her friendship quicker. You should also complete any Requests she has while she's on the map. Once Lily is level 3 , you'll have the option of inviting her to your campsite. However, she'll ask you to craft the following before joining:

How to Craft Lucky Frog in Pocket Camp Complete

How to Complete Lily's Special Request

Once Lily joins your campsite or cabin, you'll need to raise her friendship level to 15 to unlock the crafting recipe for the Lucky Frog furniture. You can continue to raise friendship the same way you've been doing until now, but it may be quicker to give her Gold Treats .

Gold Treats are a generic gift that give 25 Friendship points per bag. Giving x10 Gold Treats to an animal at Level 1 will instantly elevate them to level 15.

The Lucky Frog takes 18 hours in real time to craft, and it costs 10490 Bells to make. You'll also need these crafting materials:

  • x150 Steel
  • x2 Sparkle Stones

Sparkle Stones are a crafting material that you earn from completing Stretch/Timed Goals or villager requests. You can also get them from Gulliver's Ship by visiting specific islands or completing a Sparkle Stone Map at Blathers's Treasure Trek. Animals that reach levels 7, 9, and 20 will give you Sparkle Stones. From level 25, you'll receive x1 Sparkle Stone every 5 levels .

If you can't add the Lucky Frog to favorites, or you don't want to craft it now, you can find it in the Antique tab (globe icon) of the Craft page.

When you've crafted the Lucky Frog, you can turn in the quest to Lily. You'll earn Bells, x1 Calling Card, and x1 Request Card as well as friendship points.

Where to Use Lucky Frog

Happy Homeroom and Decorating

The Lucky Frog is a harmonious -themed furniture item, but you can place it with any type of furniture you want at your campsite or in your cabin. If you've been doing the Happy Homeroom classes, then you're going to need the Lucky Frog for six different courses:

    • Passing Grade: 310+ points

  • Temple Food Festival

  • Zen Restaurant 2
    • Passing Grade: 395+ points

item.title: Marvel Rivals Leak Reveals New Characters, Maps, and More
item.description:
Summary

  • New Marvel Rivals leak reveals upcoming characters like Deadpool and Captain Marvel, along with team-ups and maps.
  • Leaked content includes Angela, Hit-Monkey, Emma Frost, as well as various team-ups and exciting maps.
  • Leak hints at what's to come in Season 1 of Marvel Rivals, with notable characters like Ultron speculated for addition.

A new Marvel Rivals leak has revealed tons of new characters including the likes of Deadpool, Captain Marvel, and more, along with maps, team-ups, and player icons. This is by far one of the most comprehensive Marvel Rivals leaks to date, as it reveals a plethora of content that hasn't been a part of other leaks so far.

Marvel Rivals became an instant hit after its launch in early December, and fans have been quite curious to learn more about what content will be coming to the game in the near future. There have been several leaks in the past few weeks revealing what characters players might expect in the game next. However, by far one of the most credible leaks came through an official Marvel Rivals ad which accidentally showed Human Torch and The Thing from the Fantastic Four as part of the character roster. Now, a new leak gives fans some more insights into what the developers might have in store for them.

In a tweet, user X0X_LEAK reveals a bunch of exciting content for Marvel Rivals fans. Apparently, through a datamine of the launch build, several upcoming characters, maps, and team-ups in Marvel Rivals have been revealed. The leaked characters include Angela, Hit-Monkey, Deadpool, Captain Marvel, Emma Frost, Phoenix/Jean Grey, and Modok. Along with that, the leaked maps include Krakoa, Arakko, and New York. A bunch of team-ups are also a part of the leaks, which include both new and old characters. Last but not least, the leak also reveals the Marvel Rivals Season 1 image along with some player icons.

All Characters, Maps, and Team-ups Revealed in New Marvel Rivals Leak

  • Characters
    • Angela
    • Hit-Monkey
    • Deadpool
    • Captain Marvel
    • Emma Frost
    • Phoenix/Jean Grey
    • Modok

  • Team-ups
    • Squirrel X Raccoon
    • Storm X Human Torch
    • Wolverine X The Thing X Hulk
    • Wolverine X Phoenix
    • Wolverine X Magik X Psylocke X Black Panther (probably scrapped as per leak)
    • Blade X C&D X Moon Knight
    • Emma Frost X Magneto
    • Emma Frost X Psylocke
    • Emma Frost X ???

  • Maps
    • Krakoa
    • Arakko
    • New York

What's notable is that this is the first time that the Marvel Rivals characters mentioned by the leaker have been mentioned for Season 1. It is also quite surprising that none of the characters that were leaked earlier for Season 1 are in the character list, but they are still a part of the team-ups. Considering that these characters are allegedly part of the launch build, it possibly suggests that they might be quite close to being completed and getting released in the game.

Apart from members of the Fantastic Four, leaks had also suggested that Ultron could be coming to Marvel Rivals in the near future. Considering how many characters have been a part of leaks, at this point, it is quite difficult to predict which characters will be making their way into the game next. Marvel Rivals ' next major update will be coming in January, which will mark the beginning of the first season of the game. Leaks should be taken with a grain of salt, but players will definitely be getting tons of exciting content in Marvel Rivals in the near future.

item.title: Infinity Nikki Confirms Fishing Day Event Plans
item.description:
Summary

  • Infinity Nikki's Lucky Fishing Day event offers players Diamonds and exclusive rewards.
  • Version 1.1 update brings new quests, levels, and ability outfits, including the 5-Star outfit Wings of Wishes.
  • Players can expect to farm Diamonds and participate in Lucky Fishing Day to prepare for the upcoming game update.

Infinity Nikki has revealed the details of its upcoming Lucky Fishing Day event, which will grant players juicy rewards like Diamonds. Infinity Nikki will soon launch Version 1.1 as well with new levels and quests.

It has been less than a month since Infinity Nikki launched, but the dress-up RPG has already amassed a massive playerbase. Only days after its debut, Infinity Nikki surpassed 10 million downloads globally. Now, the game is getting ready for its biggest update yet with Version 1.1. The update will bring a new event titled Wish Festival, quests, and ability outfits, including the limited 5-Star outfit Wings of Wishes. To pull for 5-Star outfits, Infinity Nikki players need a currency called Diamonds, similar to Primogems in Genshin Impact . Farming for Diamonds can be a difficult task, but fortunately for players, Infinity Nikki is launching a limited event with plenty of Diamonds as rewards.

Through its official social media accounts, Infinity Nikki has announced that its Lucky Fishing Day event will go live from December 29 to January 23, 2025. As its name suggests, the event is focused on Infinity Nikki 's fishing game mode. To participate in the Lucky Fishing Day event, players are required to reach the Dream Warehouse in the game's main storyline. The event will introduce new "Lucky Moments" world quests and "Fun Encounters" random quests. Completing these quests will give players special rewards like Diamonds, the exclusive Pear-Pal title "Only the Willing," and other materials. Moreover, during the event, fans can fish Pink Ribbon Eels and exchange them with Mitcheli for more limited rewards. Finally, players will be able to meet a Croaker near the Leisureely Anglers to help them fish at the center of the lake while Lucky Fishing Day lasts.

Infinity Nikki Lucky Fishing Day Event Duration

  • December 29 to January 23, 2025
  • Requirements: Complete the main quest "Go to the Dream Warehouse!"

Lucky Fishing Day Event Quests

"Lucky Moments" World Quests

  • Mystery of the Lake Monster
  • Friendship is Bubbling!
  • Bad Luck, Good Luck

"Fun Encounters" Random Quests

  • Ribbon Eel Exchange
  • Lucky Pink Ribbon Eel
  • Kindled Inspiration: Lucky Clothing

It is worth noting that Nikki's fishing outfit is unlocked through the main quest "Unexplained Coma Incidents," so players can begin fishing quite early in the game. Fans should not pass on the opportunity to play through the Lucky Fishing Day event, as the free Diamonds could come in handy for Infinity Nikki Version 1.1.

Aside from the fishing outfit, there are several ability outfits in Infinity Nikki , with some more crucial for exploration and farming than others. Infinity Nikki Version 1.1 will go live on December 30 and developers have already shown a glimpse of what's in store for players, like two new outfits called Wings of Wishes and Starfall Radiance.

item.title: New Meta Quest Update is Bricking Some VR Headsets
item.description:
Summary

  • Recent Meta Quest update bricking headsets, including Quest 2, 3, and 3S.
  • Meta investigating issue, players warn against factory reset.
  • Meta halting problematic update, working on fix for affected headsets.

Numerous players are reporting that their Meta Quest headsets, including the Meta Quest 2, 3, and 3S, have been bricked following a recent update. The issue is impacting those who have owned Meta Quests for a long time as well as those who have just bought one, as both older headsets and new purchases have been affected.

Meta regularly releases updates for the Quest headsets that fine-tune the experience, add new features, and fix bugs. Generally, these updates roll out in waves and go off without a hitch, but something seems to have gone wrong with the most recent rollout, and fans are upset.

Starting on December 25, some Meta Quest users started reporting that their headsets weren't working properly following the most recent update. Owners of all three currently supported headsets, the Meta Quest 2, 3, and 3S, have stated that their headsets are displaying a critical error following the update. The error message, which simply states "Your device is corrupt. It can't be trusted." seems to indicate that the device has falsely flagged headsets as being modified or otherwise tampered with. While many user complaints have come from those dusting off and updating their VR headsets that have been in storage, others are brand new buyers, so it's not clear why it's impacting some Meta Quests but not all.

Fix Incoming for Meta Quest Update Bricking Headsets

After players reached out, Meta responded on its official forums, acknowledging the issue and stating that it's looking into it. However, some users are concerned about the fate of their already-bricked headsets, as they're out of warranty. It remains to be seen how the fixes will be delivered. In the meantime, players are advised to not try factory resetting Quest headsets, as some have found their units will no longer power on after doing so. Meta's official advice is to try booting up Quests that have encountered the error by pushing and holding the power button for 45 seconds.

According to some users, Meta seems to have paused the update that was causing issues, with brand-new Meta Quest headsets now being updated to the most stable version that previously released. While this might mean that users who haven't updated their headsets in a long time or have brand new ones may be in the clear, it would be wise to wait until Meta releases an official announcement and confirms that a fix has been put in place. Unfortunately, this update couldn't have had worse timing, as many gamers are trying out Quests for the first time that they received as Christmas gifts. With any luck, it won't take long for a solution to be put in place.
